title: Display addresses instead of names
content:
I use Thunderbird 115.1.0. "Show only display name for people in my address book" is not selected in the preferences. The "Full Address column" Add-on does not work with version 115.*

In all folders the names of message senders/recipients are displayed instead of the e-mail addresses. For example, it shows "My Name" in the outbox - not name@example.org, my@name.com etc. In the inbox, it is "Anna Bel" and "Zack Miller" instead of "support@mozilla.org".

I am not interested in the names. When I want to see those, I look into the mail. I need the mail addresses!

How do I get back the addresses? (I think Netscape Mail did have that feature.)

The chosen answer to a similar question, "use Full Address column Add-on", does not work for Thunderbird 115.* and up.

title: Account Inactivity
content:
I'm sure many here have by now received Google's little advisory about inactive gmail accounts. I figured I have better luck getting some answers here than jumping thru firey hoops trying to get an answer out of Google. But of course if it turns out that I have to, I will throw a short tantrum, then unwilling crawl over there.

I have three gmail accounts, ALL of which I pop to Thunderbird. I rarely log in to any of them in a browser. About the only time I log in on a browser is to see if an expected email went into the spam folder there.

One of the ways mentioned in the email that will keep an account active: "Using Sign in with Google to sign in to a third-party app or service"

Does this include Thunderbird? Is Thunderbird considered a "third-party app or service?" Or does that only apply to places that have an actual button or link that allows you to log in using Google?

Thanks in advance for any information.

This one below and another one which accuses the SMTP server as the culprit also. I changed the SMTP server to the other option on Yahoo! and it still doesn't work. Unfortunately, I don't have the wording of that msg. "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.mail.yahoo.com was lost in the middle of the transaction. Try again."

I changed the Port to 587 Default:465 server name smtp.mail.yahoo.com (wasn't changed) Connection security is SSL/TLS (wasn't changed) Authentication Method OAuth2 (wasn't changed)

Can somebody please tell me what's going on here? I despise using Yahoo! mail. How can I get back to using Thunderbird? Also, can you put the FROM: field somewhere in this part of the "Get Help" so we can know what to look for in our INBOX, b/c I may NOT see how it's presented in the FROM: field and if people are using their own name, I just skip over it b/c I don't know those people—ONLY their ORGANIZATIONS.

Thanks for your help.

Gratefully,

Aileen

title: Problem Converting Eudora emails to Thunderbird
content:
Hello everyone,

Here's my problem. After a couple years of messing around with Eudora replacements, I've decided to give TB another try. I've also been working with the Betterbird people a little (in case that matters).

I have thousands of emails still on my Eudora system, categorized by folders (2010 outbox, 2011 outbox...2022 outbox, 2022 inbox etc) and know where each of the mbx files are located.

In reading about converting, i've seen two suggestions:

1.) Use the IMPORTEXPORT add on - I tried this. It did not convert the emails into anything usable. It also looks like all attachments have been left behind. The emails ARE readable however...but not much more than that.

2.) Use an earlier version of TB to convert the old Eudora files - I had tried this a couple years ago. Using V15, I was able to convert many of the old files into usable TB files. But there are a few thousand that were NOT converted.

Here are my questions:

1.) using an earlier version of TB - how do i do this now, since I already have TB running? The instructions on how to do that are not clear. Can i load up the V15 version (again) while my current version is still running. It seems like this is a recipe for confusion.

2.) Is there any 3rd party software that makes this easier? - I've seen Corbell and one other software system advertised. I'm more interested in getting this done quickly than spending $50. This problem is holding up my final coversion from my present system (mailbird).

Thanks in advance for any insight on how to accomplish this.

Dean Calvert
creator: dmcalvert

title: Upgraded to Thunderbird 115: Calendar, contacts, and certs okay, but missing thousands of emails.
content:
Hello all,

One of our users' Thunderbird installations was recently updated from version 102.2.2 to 115.0.1.

At work, we use an offline network. We have no direct internet connection at all. We use a Microsoft Exchange mail server to handle inbound and outbound emails.

When our user got a new computer last week and first signed in to Thunderbird, her folder structure was correct, but something went wrong because her inbox and sent folders were completely empty. She would get a notification whenever someone sent her an email, but when she clicked on it, it would just show her an empty Thunderbird inbox (she should have thousands of messages).

I, and others, have verified her email server settings are correct and the same as on other systems not experiencing this issue.

Her calendar events, contacts, and email certificates are all where they should be. It's just her messages that are missing.

Now here's where it gets weirder. Having created a backup of her original Thunderbird profiles directory and profiles.ini file, I exited Thunderbird and removed those profile files/folder from her "C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird" directory. Upon restarting Thunderbird, it asked for her to log in. She used the address and username I verified were in the Exchange server, and upon signing in, her mail client synced all her messages correctly. However, as expected, her calendar and certificate info was still missing since those don't come from the Exchange server. So, when I close Thunderbird and put her original profiles back into the AppData\Roaming directory (adding, not replacing the new ones since that also doesn't work) and start Thunderbird, we're back at square one where she's got certificates, calendar events, and addresses, but no emails in the inbox or sent folders.

Has anyone seen this before?

P.S.: Sorry there are no photos. I can't post screenshots from any of our computers.
creator: mp956

title: msf files not being rebuilt

title: Sudden onset can't send email on Thunderbird
content: I like using Thunderbird, and have for years. Suddenly this morning I can't send emails. I can receive them, but I can't send them. My internet provider is spectrum and I have spent the last two hours with them trying to resolve the issue. No luck. I have verified the SMTP server and port, I have tried changing my password. The problem remains. When I send an email I get Log in to server mail.bresnan.net with my user name......failed. I can send and receive email directly through my Spectrum account (spectrum used to be bresnan) but hate having to log in 10 times a day just to see my email. I can't say I am computer literate. I have tried a restart, and turning my computer off. Neither helped. I'm hoping this is a simple fix, but I have no idea how to fix it. Spectrum did an update 2 days ago, I got FOUR Microsoft updates yesterday. Can anyone help? Thanks

title: Printing emails in Thunderbird 115.1.0 (64-bit)
content:
Hi, I upgraded to the above version last week and I love it...until yesterday and today when I needed to print out a couple of different emails. Prior to upgrading to Supernova, I never had an issue with printing, now I do. Prior, if I clicked on what appeared to be a one page email, it would print out on one page, no issues. Now, if I try and print what should be a one page email, it previews as being three pages. Page one is the headers all by itself at the top of the page with the rest of the page as blank, page two shows as the body of the email, and then page three shows the footers of the email and the attachment list (if any). Why is it doing this and how can I get it back to printing everything on one page like it should be?

I have attached copies of what the pages look like as three pages instead of being on one page like it should be.

Thanks in advance.

title: Thunderbird is laggy and locks up
content:
I experience, as man others in the forum, that T-Bird locks the cursor, and everything goes to a halt. You can actually keep typing, and most of the text will appear when the "lag is over". The issue started more than a year ago when I set up a new laptop with pre installed W10, so it was a blank installation of T-Bird. I fiddled a bit with the below registry settings, it primarily take care of resource eating nonsense from MS - it helped a bit, not much.

All this just to say, you have a problem at the T-Bird developer team, I'm not the only person reporting this, but support don't know their head from the tail.

I'm running WIN10 and have no plans of upgrading for now.

I'm not suspecting the computer which is a new one with an I7 processor and 16Gb RAM

================================================================

Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\location] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\webcam] "Value"="Deny"
